intro: Tenaxia guillarmodiae, commonly known as the Guillarmod's tenaxia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, pentagonal flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and purple. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical climates. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
